Configuring the filtering panel
The system allows to configure the displayed filtering panel in the Object registry. This panel can be used for displaying other necessary information, including buttons and fields for filtering data.
Most attributes are used to set up filtering, including source attributes.
Consider configuring the panel in the Request for loan-security documentation registry .
I. Initially, it is necessary to configure the panel itself, which will be displayed in the registry.
To do this, configure the
additional visual
of the object type profile , whose registry will be configured.
It is necessary to put the required attributes on the panel to organize the registry filtering. The System supports filtering by
multiple choice object attributes
(multiselect attributes). Other elements, such as buttons, may also be placed in the panel, if necessary.
II. In this visual setting, specify (in addition to the
basic visual settings
):
Visual type
– "
Filtering for the registry
";
Display in advanced registry search settings
– "
Yes
".
III. It is necessary to display the previously configured panel in the object registry. To do this, in the Registry settings, on the
"Filters" tab
, specify:
Display the advanced search when opening the registry
– select "
Yes
", to display the panel immediately when opening the registry. If necessary, the panel can be hidden by pressing the
button.
Filtering visualization
– select the
previously created visual
; in the present example - "Filter for loan-security documentation".
This is how the filtering panel in the object registry is configured.
Custom actions (buttons)
can be configured to work with the registry. The attribute values specified in the filtering panel are taken into account in the algorithms used in configuring the "
Call algorithm
" action.
The values of these attributes are not taken into account
when working with
custom actions
.
